              [
                "n",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " is a closure. It is a function (defined by "
              ],
              [
                "f",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                ") which also has an associated environment (scope of "
              ],
              [
                "NaturalNumbers",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                ")."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "text",
          "version": 1
        }
      },
      "49d90656-c4c1-4382-bc46-9816afd4193f": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",

          "last_edited_time": 1532156042298,
          "parent_id": "04b23c4e-787a-43b3-9d3f-3b26fed1b355",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              [
                "Within the body of an anonymous function (say "
              ],
              [
                "f",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                ") defined within another function (say "
              ],
              [
                "g",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                "), variables present in scopes of both "
              ],
              [
                "f",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " and "
              ],
              [
                "g",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " are accessible. However, it is the scope of "
              ],
              [
                "g",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " that forms the environment part of the closure (function part is "
              ],
              [
                "f",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                ") and as a result, changes made to the variables in "
              ],
              [
                "g",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                "’s scope retain their values (i.e. the environment persists between calls to "
              ],
              [
                "f",
                [
                  [
                    "c"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                ")."
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "text",
          "version": 5
        }
      },

              [
                "A "
              ],
              [
                "closure",
                [
                  [
                    "i"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [
                " is a function taken together with an environment. The function is typically an anonymous function defined inside another function. The environment is the lexical scope of the enclosing function (very basic idea of a lexical scope of a function would be the scope that exists between the function’s braces.)"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "type": "text",

              [
                "func multiples(i int) func() int {\n    var x int = 0\n    return func() int {\n        x++\n        // paramenter to multiples (here it is i) also forms\n        // a part of the environment, and is retained\n        return x * i\n    }\n}\n\ntwo := multiples(2)\nfmt.Println(two(), two(), two()) // 2 4 6\n\nfortyTwo := multiples(42)\nfmt.Println(fortyTwo(), fortyTwo(), fortyTwo()) // 42 84 126"
              ]
            ]

                  [
                    "c"

                ]
              ],

                " are closures containing same function part (which gives them the same behavior), but different environments. Thus, use of closures allow functions to have access to a persistent environment that can be used to retain information between calls."
